Traumatic Brain Injury Explorer

Hirad and colleagues (2019) used MRI to measure the structural changes that occur in an athlete’s brain from a single season of football. The critical finding is that there are stereotyped patterns of brain injury that are asymptomiatic—meaning no signs or symptoms of concussion. The tools below provide a visalization of how force loading during football affects brain structure.

Hirad, Bazarian, Merchant-Borna, Garcea, Heilbronner, Paul, Hintz, van Wijngaarden, Schifitto, Wright, Espinoza, and Mahon. (2019). A common neural signature of brain injury in concussion and sub-concussion. Science Advances.
